alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Pleasants; Ritchie; Tyler; Wirt; Wood (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 11:20PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Meigs, Washington, eastern Morgan, southeastern Athens, Pleasants, western Ritchie, central Wirt, western Tyler, northern Jackson and Wood Counties through MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1120 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Caldwell to 9 miles southwest of Beverly to near Forked Run State Park. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Parkersburg, Marietta, Belpre, Harrisville, St. Marys, Beverly, Elizabeth, Coolville, Forked Run State Park, Vienna, Ravenswood, Williamstown, Paden City, Sistersville, Belmont, Mineralwells, Washington, North Bend State Park, Lubeck and Boaz. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 150 and 186. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 1 and 17. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 38. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Jackson; Pleasants; Ritchie; Tyler; Wirt; Wood
